title: Six arrested after 18-year-old Dalit girl in Kerala alleges sexual abuse by 62 people over five years - Moneycontrol
summary:
Six Arrested After Allegations of Sexual Abuse by 62 Individuals in Kerala

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Kerala Police have arrested six individuals after an 18-year-old Dalit girl alleged that she was sexually abused by 62 people over five years.

  • The allegations came to light when volunteers from the Kerala Mahila Samakhya Society met with the girl during a routine visit.
  • Two FIRs have been filed, and six people were arrested, with the investigation ongoing.
  • The girl has undergone counseling and disclosed her experiences to the Child Welfare Committee.
  • The abuse allegedly started when she was 13 years old.
‚ÄúA deputy superintendent of police is leading the inquiry,‚Äù said Pathanamthitta Superintendent of Police, V G Vinod Kumar.

This case sheds light on the serious issue of sexual abuse and highlights the importance of support systems for survivors.
newTitle: Six Arrested After Allegations of Sexual Abuse by 62 Individuals in Kerala

title: Tiku Talsania suffers massive heart attack, critical: reports - TOI Etimes
summary:
Tiku Talsania suffers massive heart attack, critical: reports

Tiku Talsania, renowned for his comedic roles in films like Andaz Apna Apna, has reportedly suffered a massive heart attack and is currently in critical condition at 70 years of age. Details about his condition remain scarce as of now.

  • Tiku Talsania has suffered a heart attack and is in critical condition.

In conclusion, Tiku Talsania's health condition raises concerns among fans and the film industry, marking a difficult moment for a beloved figure in Indian cinema.
newTitle: Tiku Talsania suffers massive heart attack, critical: reports

title: Aamir Khan quits smoking: When he said his cigarette smoke affected ex-wife Kiran Rao, but she wasn't ‚Äòaverse‚Äô to pipe - Hindustan Times
summary:
Aamir Khan Quits Smoking Ahead of Son's Film Release

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aamir Khan announced on January 11, 2025, that he has quit smoking in preparation for his son Junaid Khan's film, Loveyapa. He explained that he has previously struggled with smoking but is committed to supporting his son during his career launch.

  • Aamir Khan recently quit smoking for his son's film release.
  • He had switched from cigarettes to pipe smoking a few years ago.
  • Kiran Rao, Aamir's ex-wife, was affected by his cigarette smoking but was not averse to pipe smoking.
  • Aamir has had a long history with smoking and has tried cigars but did not enjoy them.
  • He feels a personal sacrifice is needed as a father to support his son.
‚ÄúI quit smoking for two-three years when I was training for Dhoom 3. But then, I went back to it again.‚Äù - Aamir Khan

Aamir Khan's decision to quit smoking reflects his desire to enhance his role as a father as his son begins his film career.
newTitle: Aamir Khan Quits Smoking Ahead of Son's Film Release

Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan and Shankar film underwhelms on first day in India - PINKVILLA
summary:
Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan and Shankar film underwhelms on first day in India

Updated on Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Game Changer had a disappointing start at the Indian box office, collecting an approximate of Rs. 60 crore on its first day, which is considered underwhelming given the expectations set by its massive budget.

  • The film grossed Rs. 59.50 crore on its opening day.
  • Collections in Telugu states were below expectations, significantly lower than the targeted Rs. 60-65 crore.
  • The Hindi version performed the best with Rs. 7 crore NETT.
  • Low occupancy rates were observed with less than 50% in regular shows.
  • The performance was notably poor in Tamil Nadu and Kerala, traditionally strong markets for director Shankar.
‚ÄúA little salt blends well with flour,‚Äù but here the salt is probably more than flour.

This lackluster performance raises questions about the film's future at the box office, given the high expectations set by its marketing and budget.
newTitle: Game Changer Box Office Collections: Ram Charan and Shankar film underwhelms on first day in India

title: Assam reports first HMPV case this season as 10-month-old child tests positive in Dibrugarh - Hindustan Times
summary:
Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Assam has reported its first case of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection this season, with a 10-month-old child testing positive. The infant is currently undergoing treatment at Assam Medical College and Hospital (AMCH) in Dibrugarh and is said to be stable.

  • Ten-month-old child tests positive for HMPV in Dibrugarh, Assam.
  • Child admitted to AMCH with cold-related symptoms four days ago.
  • HMPV infection confirmed by ICMR-RMRC Lahowal after routine tests.
  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild symptoms.
  • Similar HMPV cases reported in Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu.
‚ÄúThe HMPV infection was confirmed yesterday after we got test results from Lahowal-based ICMR-RMRC. The child is stable now. It is a common virus, and there is nothing to worry about.‚Äù - Dr. Dhrubajyoti Bhuyan, AMCH superintendent

The detection of HMPV is not unusual, as the virus circulates seasonally and typically impacts infants and individuals with weaker immune systems more severely.
newTitle: Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

title: Game Changer worldwide box office collection day 1: Ram Charan film opens big, yet over ‚Çπ100 cr behind Pushpa 2 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Game Changer worldwide box office collection day 1: After earning over ‚Çπ50 crore domestically, the action entertainer earns more than thrice globally.

Date: Jan 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The film "Game Changer," directed by S Shankar and starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has made a spectacular opening at the box office with a worldwide collection of ‚Çπ186 crore on its first day. Despite this impressive debut, it trails significantly behind the blockbuster "Pushpa 2."

  • Game Changer earned ‚Çπ51.25 crore domestically on its opening day.
  • The film is set in the political landscape, following an IAS officer's struggle against corruption.
  • Pushpa 2 had an opening day collection of ‚Çπ294 crore, outpacing Game Changer by over ‚Çπ100 crore.
‚ÄúThe king's arrival is setting the box office ablaze. #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE. GROSSES 186 CRORES WORLDWIDE on Day 1.‚Äù

In conclusion, while "Game Changer" shows strong numbers on its opening day, it has a long way to go to match the success of other major Telugu films such as "Pushpa 2."

Highlights | HMPV Cases in India: Total Case Count Increases To 13, 2 New HMPV Virus Reported; Check - Zee News
summary:
HMPV Cases in India Rise to 13

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Zee News

The number of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in India has increased to 13, raising concerns about a potential outbreak during the Mahakumbh festival, with millions expected to attend.

  • Current reported cases include two in Bengaluru, one in Gujarat, two in Chennai, three in Kolkata, two in Nagpur, and one in Mumbai.
  • HMPV, identified in 2001, has been circulating globally and is linked to respiratory infections.
  • An 80-year-old man's hospitalization due to HMPV symptoms was confirmed positive.
  • The Health Ministry reassures that they are prepared to handle any surge in respiratory illnesses.
  • Costs for HMPV RT-PCR testing range from Rs 3,000 to Rs 8,000, with comprehensive tests up to Rs 20,000.
‚ÄúHMPV is not a new virus; it has been circulating globally for many years,‚Äù said Union Health Minister JP Nadda.

As the festival approaches, health officials are closely monitoring the situation to prevent any major health risks.
newTitle: HMPV Cases in India Rise to 13, Concerns Over Spread During Mahakumbh

title: Congress's ‚Äòdamage control‚Äô dig at PM Narendra Modi's ‚ÄòI am not a God‚Äô comment in Nikhil Kamath's podcast - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Critiques PM Modi's Podcast Remarks on Being Human

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast, PM Narendra Modi stated that he is human and can make mistakes, a claim met with skepticism from Congress leader Jairam Ramesh, who accused the Prime Minister of engaging in damage control due to his previous assertion of being 'non-biological'.

  • Modi acknowledged his humanity and capacity for mistakes during a podcast with Nikhil Kamath.
  • Ramesh's critique refers to Modi's earlier statement on his 'non-biological' status made just months prior.
  • Modi emphasized the need for idealism in politics over strict ideological adherence.
‚ÄúThis from a man who proclaimed his non-biological status just eight months back. This is clearly damage control.‚Äù - Jairam Ramesh

The exchange highlights ongoing tensions between Congress and the ruling party regarding Modi's leadership narrative.
newTitle: Congress Critiques PM Modi's Podcast Remarks on Being Human

title: BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report

Date: 11 January 2025Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has reversed its decision regarding KL Rahul's participation in the upcoming ODI series against England. Initially resting him, the board has now requested his availability as they aim to provide him with match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy in February.

  • BCCI had initially agreed to KL Rahul's break from the ODI assignment.
  • Recent developments show the board now wants him available for selection.
  • Rahul's performance in the Test series in Australia was notable, being the third-highest run-getter for India.
  • Competition for the wicketkeeper batter's slot includes Rishabh Pant and Sanju Samson.
  • The board is seeking an extension from the ICC for the Champions Trophy squad announcement.
‚ÄúThe selectors initially decided to rest Rahul‚Ä¶ However, they had a rethink and the BCCI has now asked him to play‚Ä¶‚Äù

This change signifies the BCCI's emphasis on Rahul's performance potential and readiness for future tournaments, demonstrating a dynamic approach to player management.
newTitle: BCCI Changes Its Mind on KL Rahul's ODI Selection for England Series

title: Indian economy likely to be 'a little weaker' in 2025: IMF MD - Moneycontrol
summary:
IMF Projects Slight Weakness in Indian Economy for 2025

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian economy is expected to be "a little weaker" in 2025, as per IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva, who attributes this forecast to uncertainty in global trade policies, particularly from the US.

  • IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva stated the Indian economy's anticipated weakness despite global growth.
  • Concerns raised about regional divergence in economic performance globally.
  • Georgieva cited rising long-term interest rates as a global challenge.
  • The US economy is performing better than earlier projections, while the EU is experiencing stagnation.
"The US is doing quite a bit better than we expected before, the EU is somewhat stalling, (and) India a little weaker," said Kristalina Georgieva.

Moving forward, details regarding the Indian economy's trajectory will be further elaborated during the upcoming World Economy Outlook update week.
newTitle: IMF Projects Slight Weakness in Indian Economy for 2025

Henry and Co restrict SL to 290 despite Nissanka, Kusal fifties - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Henry and Co restrict SL to 290 despite Nissanka, Kusal fifties

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

In a tightly contested ODI, Sri Lanka managed to score 290 for 8 thanks to Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis, who both achieved rapid fifties. Despite a middle-order slowdown, Janith Liyanage's steady batting helped Sri Lanka post a competitive total against New Zealand.

  • Sri Lanka scored 290 for 8 in their innings, with Nissanka (66), Kusal (54), and Liyanage (53) being the top scorers.
  • New Zealand's Matt Henry took 4 wickets for 55 runs, leading the bowling attack.
  • The innings saw a middle-order collapse as New Zealand's spinners applied pressure.
  • Nissanka retired hurt due to a hamstring strain but returned to contribute to the total.
  • Sri Lanka scored 53 runs in the last six overs, attacking aggressively towards the end.
"Sri Lanka had been coasting on 155 for 1 after 27 overs... but New Zealand's spinners stemmed the flow of runs."

New Zealand's disciplined bowling showcased their ability to capitalize on mistakes, while Sri Lanka's batting depth was tested throughout the innings, suggesting a competitive chase ahead.
newTitle: Henry and Co restrict SL to 290 despite Nissanka, Kusal fifties

Why a full moon might mess with your sleep, according to science - VOGUE India
summary:
Why a full moon might mess with your sleep, according to science

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: self.com

Research indicates that a full moon may disrupt sleep, with studies showing that individuals take longer to fall asleep and experience less deep sleep during this lunar phase.

  • A study in 2013 revealed that on full moon nights, people took five minutes longer to fall asleep and had 30% less deep sleep.
  • A 2014 study confirmed similar findings, with participants getting an average of 25 minutes less sleep during full moons.
  • The reasons behind this phenomenon are debated, with theories including evolutionary adaptations and the moon‚Äôs gravitational effects.
‚ÄúWhen our ancestors were hunting and gathering, it was highly adaptive to extend the end of the day.‚Äù - Dr. Horacio de la Iglesia

To mitigate sleep disruptions, experts recommend adjusting bedtime and maintaining good sleep practices.
newTitle: Why a Full Moon Affects Your Sleep: Insights from Science

title: 'Chat GPT product': Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana called out for supporting Gautam Gambhir with similar statements - Hindustan Times
summary:
Harshit and Nitish Rana Called Out for Supporting Gautam Gambhir

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana have come under scrutiny for their identical statements on social media in support of Gautam Gambhir, following comments made by Manoj Tiwary that criticized Gambhir‚Äôs coaching methods.

  • Manoj Tiwary labeled Gambhir a "hypocrite" for supporting foreign coaches despite previously criticizing their appointment.
  • Aakash Chopra pointed out the similarities in Rana's statements, suggesting they feel like a "Chat GPT product".
  • Gambhir's coaching received backlash after India‚Äôs recent losses, including the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
Aakash Chopra stated, "There are many similarities in both statements, or someone wrote them and sent them to post on social media. It felt like both statements were written by the same man or machine. It could be Chat GPT, for all we know."

The controversy highlights concerns regarding Gambhir's coaching effectiveness and the authenticity of public support from players.
newTitle: Harshit and Nitish Rana Called Out for Supporting Gautam Gambhir
